SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.planner.plannerManagerDialogs

Class DialogListeners<T extends TaskDialogUI>

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.planner.plannerManagerDialogs.DialogListeners<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of dialog handled by DialogListeners, which can be TaskAddingDialogUI or its subclass
public class DialogListeners<T extends TaskDialogUI> extends Object
Represents the UI handling for instances of TaskAddingDialogUI and TaskEditingDialogUI, managing user interactions and events within the JDialog.

Fields:
  • dialog - a JDialog reference containing an instance of type DialogListeners
  • task - a SingleTaskManager reference containing a task instance of type DialogListeners
Methods:
  • setupListeners() - adds listeners to all components of dialog
Listeners creators:
  • createButtonsListener() - creates a listener for buttons in the DialogListeners instance
  • createWeekDaysComboBoxListener() - creates a listener for the weekdays' JComboBox in the DialogListeners instance
  • createTimeSpinnerListener() - creates a listener for the time's JSpinner in the DialogListeners instance
  • createDescriptionTextAreaListener() - creates a listener for the description's JTextArea in the DialogListeners instance
  • createTasksComboBoxListener() - creates a listener for the tasks' JComboBox in the DialogListeners instance
  • createIsDoneComboBoxListener() - creates a listener for the isDone's JComboBox in the DialogListeners instance
  • createPrioritySpinnerListener() - creates a listener for the priority's JSpinner in the DialogListeners instance

  • Constructor Details

    • DialogListeners

      public DialogListeners(T dialog)
      Constructs a new DialogListeners instance with the specified dialog. This constructor initializes references to the task and dialog fields, and then calls the setupListeners() method to add listeners to the dialog's components.
      Parameters:
      dialog - a JDialog instance representing TaskAddingDialogUI or its subclass
      See Also:
      • TaskAddingDialogUI.configureTaskAddingDialog()
      • TaskEditingDialogUI.configureTaskEditingDialog()

  • Method Details

    • setupListeners

      private void setupListeners()
      Adds listeners to the components within the dialog instance. Listeners are created using the methods from this class: createButtonsListener(), createTasksComboBoxListener(), createWeekDaysComboBoxListener(), createTimeSpinnerListener(), createPrioritySpinnerListener(), createDescriptionTextAreaListener(), and createIsDoneComboBoxListener().
      See Also:
      • DialogListeners(T)

    • createButtonsListener

      private ActionListener createButtonsListener()
      Creates an ActionListener for the saving button within the dialog field. Depending on the type of dialog, this method performs two kinds of saving action:

      • If dialog is of type TaskEditingDialogUI, it removes the old version of the task from TaskDialogUI.planners and adds the edited one. Then, it invokes TaskEditingDialogUI.setTaskEdited(boolean) method with a value of true, and disposes the dialog.
      • If dialog is of type TaskAddingDialogUI, it adds the new task to TaskDialogUI.planners, invokes the TaskAddingDialogUI.setTaskAdded(boolean) with a value of true, and disposes the dialog.
      Returns:
      an ActionListener for the saving button in the dialog field. May produce null if dialog is neither TaskEditingDialogUI nor TaskAddingDialogUI.
      See Also:
      • setupListeners()

    • createWeekDaysComboBoxListener

      private ActionListener createWeekDaysComboBoxListener()
      Creates an ActionListener for TaskDialogUI.weekDaysComboBox that listens for user selection changes. When a user selects an item in the combo box, this listener retrieves the selected WeekDays instance based on the selected index and assigns it to the SingleTaskManager.weekDay property of task.
      Returns:
      an ActionListener for the TaskDialogUI.weekDaysComboBox
      See Also:
      • setupListeners()

    • createTimeSpinnerListener

      private ChangeListener createTimeSpinnerListener()
      Creates a ChangeListener for TaskDialogUI.timeSpinner that listens for changes in the selected time value. When a user selects a value in the spinner, this listener retrieves the selected value, converts it to a String, and assigns it to the SingleTaskManager.time property of task.
      Returns:
      a ChangeListener for the TaskDialogUI.timeSpinner
      See Also:
      • setupListeners()

    • createPrioritySpinnerListener

      private ChangeListener createPrioritySpinnerListener()
      Creates a ChangeListener for TaskDialogUI.prioritySpinner that listens for changes in the selected priority value. When a user selects a value in the spinner, this listener retrieves the selected value, converts it to a Byte, and assigns it to the SingleTaskManager.priority property of task.
      Returns:
      a ChangeListener for the TaskDialogUI.prioritySpinner
      See Also:
      • setupListeners()

    • createDescriptionTextAreaListener

      private DocumentListener createDescriptionTextAreaListener()
      Creates a DocumentListener for TaskDialogUI.descriptionTextArea that listens for changes in the text area. When a user inserts or removes text in the text area, this listener retrieves the updated text content and assigns it to the SingleTaskManager.description property of task.
      Returns:
      a DocumentListener for the TaskDialogUI.descriptionTextArea
      See Also:
      • setupListeners()

    • createTasksComboBoxListener

      private ActionListener createTasksComboBoxListener()
      Creates an ActionListener for TaskDialogUI.tasksComboBox that listens for user selection changes. When a user selects an item in the combo box, this listener retrieves the selected task name, converts it to the String, and assigns it to the SingleTaskManager.taskName property of task.
      Returns:
      an ActionListener for the TaskDialogUI.tasksComboBox
      See Also:
      • setupListeners()

    • createIsDoneComboBoxListener

      private ActionListener createIsDoneComboBoxListener()
      Creates an ActionListener for TaskEditingDialogUI.isDoneComboBox that listens for user selection changes. When a user selects an item in the combo box, this listener retrieves the selected item and assigns its boolean equivalent to the SingleTaskManager.isDone property of task.
      Returns:
      an ActionListener for the TaskEditingDialogUI.isDoneComboBox
      See Also:
      • setupListeners()
